candidates.title: Reduce memory usage of rate limiting
candidates.body:
`RateLimitStorage` grows whenever a new IP address makes a request, so it's extremely important to make it use as little memory as possible.

The biggest problem is that old buckets are not deleted, so the memory consumption just keeps on growing. This could cause the server to run out of memory. To fix this, I added a weekly task that causes an IP address's buckets to be deleted after 1 to 2 weeks of inactivity (or more if any rate limit interval is longer than 1 week).

And here's each step in my process of optimizing the `buckets` field of `RateLimitStorage`:

`HashMap<RateLimitType, HashMap<IpAddr, RateLimitBucket>>` (original)

* `IpAddr` is a wrapper for `String`. `RateLimitBucket` values for all `RateLimitType`s are initialized when an IP address is added, so there's always one `IpAddr` stored for each `RateLimitType`. On a 64 bit machine, they use a total of at least 186 bytes per IP address (each `String` stores 24 bytes inline, and has at least the amount of characters in "0.0.0.0").

`HashMap<IpAddr, HashMap<RateLimitType, RateLimitBucket>>`

* Now, for each IP address, only one `IpAddr` is stored instead of six.

`HashMap<IpAddr, EnumMap<RateLimitType, RateLimitBucket>>`

* `EnumMap` only stores an inline fixed-sized array: `[RateLimitBucket; 6]`. It doesn't store things like length, pointers, or even keys. This is the most compact it can be.

`HashMap<Ipv6Addr, EnumMap<RateLimitType, RateLimitBucket>>`

* `Ipv6Addr` is only 16 bytes. This uses less memory than an empty `String`.

I also made `RateLimitBucket` 3 times smaller, which saves 96 bytes per IP address.

candidates.title: Upgrade activitypub-federation to 0.4.1
candidates.body: This improves logging so that its not necessary to enable debug logs to find out that activity worker count needs to be increased.

candidates.title: Fixes #1884 - Support Spoiler Tags
candidates.body:
# WHAT & WHY

Adds support for managing spoiler blocks by:
- Switching to [markdown-it.rs](https://github.com/rlidwka/markdown-it.rs), a Rust port of the`markdown-it` library used by the UI and, more importantly, supports adding and creating custom plugins.
  - Unfortunately, the library `comrak` nor another potentially performant library `pulldown-cmark` do not appear to have any support for plugins so the library switch is necessary.
- Adding a custom spoiler plugin to handle parsing spoiler tags.
- Writing basic tests to ensure that nothing should change due to the library swap. If the library needs to be changed again later, it should help with backwards compatibility checking.

This is my first time writing in Rust, so apologies for any obvious semantic mistakes 🙏

candidates.title: Remove chatserver
candidates.body:
This code isnt used anymore now that websocket is already removed from main branch. Code looks much cleaner already. Still need to fix captchas by storing them in db.

Edit: somehow prettier is failing in ci, but passing locally

candidates.title: update diesel to 2.1.0 and diesel-async to 0.3.0 (issue #2882)
Add CORS support for debug mode.
candidates.body: This adds a permissive CORS when running lemmy in debug mode. This helps for doing front end development, so that you can use a different port / origin using the http client, without having to install a browser plugin.

candidates.title: Remove websocket code
candidates.body: I was hoping to get rid of the `Perform` traits. But then API handlers would have to call `SendActivity` directly, which doesnt move unless we move all of it to the same crate. So for now Im simply removing the websocket code without any other changes. Maybe in the future we can improve this further.

candidates.title: Optimize fetching of post url metadata
candidates.body:
- [Dont retry outgoing HTTP requests](https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/commit/11a65c9580571d5c874313841b679c61574deedf)
- [Dont refetch post url metadata when post is received again](https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/commit/37d0543f96acf5bebd9307680a529fd3a037a735)

candidates.title: Adding typescript generation for API. Fixes #2824
candidates.body:
This PR:

- Adds annotations to automatically generate typescript types from our API, view, and db table structs. These can then be directly imported into lemmy-js-client. 
  - When developing or changing our types, this automates the process, so I don't have to manually figure out and edit which exact types changed.
  - It outputs these to `binding/` folders, which are `.gitignored` here, but I wrote a script for `lemmy-js-client` to copy them over.
- Cleaned up some API issues.

candidates.title: Adding diesel enums for SortType and ListingType
candidates.body:
- Uses diesel-derive-enum.
- Adds diesel.toml , so we can again use the auto-generated schema.rs
- Fixes a lot of DB null issues and column ordering issues.
- Fixes #1136
- Also replaces RegistrationMode boilerplate.
